recommendations: Dmitry Fedoseyev “I am pleased to recommend Pawan as an exceptional iOS Swift engineer. In our time working together, Pawan has consistently demonstrated a deep understanding of iOS development, particularly with low-level APIs. His expertise in handling complex tasks such as sending image buffers between app and app extension and audio routing has been invaluable. Pawan's proficiency in SwiftUI is impressive, allowing him to create intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces. He often provides insightful feedback to our design team, enhancing the overall user experience with thoughtful and constructive suggestions. His technical skills, combined with a collaborative approach and a keen eye for design, make Pawan an outstanding asset to any development team. I highly recommend him for any iOS development role.”

Tejus Adiga M “Pawan is very passionate about what he does. He is a self-starter and he often thinks on the lines of how the feature should be rather than how to make it work. He is very creative and can communicate his thoughts clearly. Pawan is a critical thinker and not afraid to question assumptions. In working with him I have seen him getting involved in each and everything and making great contributions.”
publications: [{"title":"Polyp shape estimation from endoscopy video using EKF monocular SLAM with SFS model prior","subtitle":"IEEE","date":"February 22, 2018","description":"In this paper, a new approach to recover 3D shape of a polyp from the endoscopic video is proposed. For this, a point light source of illumination, perspective projection and six-degree motion of the endoscope are considered. Previous approaches attempted to recover polyp shape with the help of extended Kalman filter (EKF) and monocular simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) from a static scene. Our approach uses iterative data acquisition approach with the existing EKF Monocular SLAM and the intensity model prior. Our method constructs a dense 3D model of polyp by utilizing sparse data, which are collected by a Monocular EKF SLAM and a base model prior. Experimental results show the efficacy of our proposed method."}]

projects: [{"title":"100ms RoomKit SDK for iOS","start_date":"Sep 2023","description":"RoomKit SDK for iOS (SwiftUI) enables you to integrate our production-ready conferencing and live-streaming UI into your own app effortlessly."},{"title":"100ms Meeting Room Models SDK for iOS","start_date":"Jun 2023","description":"Meeting room models that simplify SwiftUI based application development using 100ms SDK."},{"title":"Patents","start_date":"Jan 2018","end_date":"Present"},{"title":"See My Apps on App Store","start_date":"2018","end_date":"Present","description":"Created and Published 10+ Apps on App Store in Swift"},{"title":"Neural Network","start_date":"2015","description":"A Neural Network in C++"},{"title":"Eye-Tracking system for ensuring driver safety in cars","description":"Guide: Dr. M. K. Bhuyan, Assistant Professor, Department of EEE, IIT Guwahati•The goal of the project was to come up with a car mounted device which ensures driver safety by using Eye-Tracking and GPS data.• Eye Tracking was implemented using openCV. Algorithm used was from 'Eye centre localisation by means of gradients by Timm and Barth'.•. Raspberry Pi 2 was used to process GPS speed/location data complementing Eye-Tracking for coming up with an Algorithm to ensure driver safety."},{"title":"Face Recognition","description":"Guide : Dr. Suresh Sundaram, Professor, Department of EEE, IIT Guwahati•Image classifier for Face Recognition using Principle Component Analysis Algorithm"},{"title":"Game in Unity Platform","description":"•Participated in Microsoft hacking event Microsoft Code-Fun-Do - Written a 3D game tactics unity."},{"title":"On-Premise site migration to cloud.","description":"Guide : Mr. Ronojoy Chatterjee, Project Manager at MAQ Software •Technologies Used: Microsoft SharePoint, Microsoft Visual Studio, TFS, REST API, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript."},{"title":"Online Bus Schedule for IITG","description":"Google Hackathon winner for our application of online bus schedule for IITG.This is an app which can show current bus schedule for buses going to the city from IITG campus and vice-versa."},{"title":"Snake like robot with passive wheels and wireless control","description":"Guide : Dr. Prithwijit Guha, Assistant Professor, Department of EEE, IIT Guwahati•This Project aims to create a snake like robot which can be used for surveillance purpose by reaching to inaccessible locations and providing video feed with the help of camera mounted on its head.• ZigBee modules were used for wireless control."},{"title":"User Registration System With Authentication","description":"Guide : Mr. Ronojoy Chatterjee, Project Manager at MAQ Software•Technologies Used: MVC, SQL"}]
